Class CandyRecommender

  • java.lang.Object
    • CandyRecommender

  • public class CandyRecommender
extends java.lang.Object
    This program reads candies and their ingredients from a file. It then asks the user which of those ingredients they like/dislike. Finally, it rates the candies and tells the user which ones they would probably like.

    • Method Detail

      • readCandyFile

        private static void readCandyFile()
                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Read the candy information from the file called Candy.txt. The file should be formatted like this: candy name:ingredient 1, ingredient 2 Initializes the candies list and the ingredientMap.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the Candy.txt file cannot be found.

      • getUserPreferences

        private static void getUserPreferences()
        For each ingredient found in any candy, ask the user if they like, dislike, or are neutral about that ingredient.

      • findLikedCandies

        private static java.util.Set<Candy> findLikedCandies()
        Recommend candies that you think the user will like based upon their likes and dislikes and what the candies contain. It will not suggest any candidates that contain ingredients the user dislikes. It will give a score to candies that contain only ingredients the user likes. A higher score is better.
        Returns:
        the candies that this user would probably like

      • recommendCandies

        private static void recommendCandies(java.util.Set<Candy> possible)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Reads the candies from a file, asks the user for their likes and dislikes, and makes a recommendation
        Parameters:
        args - none
